TaskDescription.Detail: Open a new Excel file to input data and style the cells. - Font setting, Font color, Background color, Bold, Underline setting - Border settings - Set cell size

Assist.value: You can designate a variable to contain the opened Excel file. Store in RESULT by default.
Click the Run button to open a new Excel file.
Write a value in the area specified in the Excel file.
Specify the values ​​to be input as an array. Input this.data. (The variable is assigned a value to be Input.)
Input the cell address to start typing. Values ​​are Input from 'A1'.
Click the Run button to check the input value.
Set the horizontal and vertical size of the specified area.
Specifies the range. Input 'A1:C5'.
Set the horizontal size. Input 30.
Set the vertical size. Input 30.
Click the Run button to check the cell size.
Specifies the range. Input 'A1:C5'.
Specifies the border type. Select All Borders.
Click the Run button to check the border settings.
Set the font color of the specified area.
Specifies the range. Input 'B1:B5'.
Specifies the color based on RGB values. Input '0,0,255'. (blue)
Set the background color of the specified area.
Specifies the range. Input 'C1:C5'.
Specifies the color based on RGB values. Input '255,255,0'. (yellow)
Sets the text in the specified area to be bold.
Specifies the range. Input 'A2:C2'.
Set True to make bold.
Underline the specified area.
Specifies the range. Input 'A3:C3'.
Set True to make underline.
Sets horizontal alignment in the specified area.
Specifies the range. Input 'A4:C4'.
Select Center as horizontal alignment.
Set the font size in the specified area.
Specifies the range. Input 'A5:C5'.
Set font size to 15.
